title: What the font?
content:
Saw this the other day. Kinda reminds me of copperplate. Any Ideas?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080228132852/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_110.png) | 24.7 KB |

 [‹ Bad Idea Magazine Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080228132852/http:/typophile.com/node/42440 "Go to previous forum topic") [Adjaye Architects Typeface ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080228132852/http:/typophile.com/node/42442 "Go to next forum topic")
author: typevolcom

comments.content:
LUXE shows signs of [squooshing](http://web.archive.org/web/20080228132852/http:/typophile.com/wiki/squoosh). Could be [Trade Gothic Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20080228132852/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/trade_gothic_lt_std_extended_ot/?sample_text=LUXE&sample_size=60) with slabs attached.

MAGAZINE is [FF DIN](http://web.archive.org/web/20080228132852/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_din_ot_regular/?sample_text=MAGAZINE)
really? anyone have any other guesses?

Really. Note that the horizontal strokes on LUXE are thicker than the vertical strokes. This is an indication of mechanically scaling the type so that it’s narrower. The bracketless line serifs are easily added.
